014package org.jdbi.v3.core.result;
015
016import java.util.ArrayList;
017import java.util.Collections;
018import java.util.LinkedList;
019import java.util.List;
020import java.util.function.Supplier;
021
022/**
023 * Extend the {@link ResultIterable} for batch operations.
024 * @param <T>
025 */
026public interface BatchResultIterable<T> extends ResultIterable<T> {
027
028    /**
029     * Split the results into per-batch sub-lists. Note that this may not be correct if any of the executed batches returned an error code.
030     *
031     * @return results in a {@link List} of {@link List}s.
032     */
033    List<List<T>> listPerBatch();
034
035    static <U> BatchResultIterable<U> of(ResultIterable<U> delegate, Supplier<int[]> modifiedRowCountsSupplier) {
036
037        return new BatchResultIterable<U>() {
038            @Override
039            public List<List<U>> listPerBatch() {
040                List<List<U>> results = new LinkedList<>();
041                try (ResultIterator<U> iterator = delegate.iterator()) {
042                    for (int modCount : modifiedRowCountsSupplier.get()) {
043                        if (modCount <= 0) {
044                            // error return (SUCCESS_NO_INFO or EXECUTE_FAILED) or empty.
045                            results.add(Collections.emptyList());
046                        } else {
047                            List<U> batchResult = new ArrayList<>(modCount);
048                            for (int i = 0; i < modCount; i++) {
049                                batchResult.add(iterator.next());
050                            }
051                            results.add(batchResult);
052                        }
053                    }
054                }
055                return results;
056            }
057
058            @Override
059            public ResultIterator<U> iterator() {
060                return delegate.iterator();
061            }
062        };
063    }
064}
